definitions.definition: Absence of order ; state of not being arranged in an orderly manner.
examples: After playing the children left the room in disorder .

definitions.definition: A disturbance of civic peace or of public order .
examples: The class was thrown into disorder when the teacher left the room
The army tried to prevent disorder when claims the elections had been rigged grew stronger.

main_definition: Absence of order ; state of not being arranged in an orderly manner.
secondary_definitions: A disturbance of civic peace or of public order .
( medicine , countable ) A physical or mental malfunction .
